website_summaries.verdict: If you're looking for an affordable bulk pack of cat claw caps, this colorful assortment is worth considering. However, they aren't quite as robust as pricier options.
pros: A total of 140 nail caps in 14 different hues gives you loads of interesting color combinations to choose from
Includes glue and fine tipped, user-friendly applicators
Available in a variety of sizes to fit kittens and cats of all sizes
cons: While they do a good job of staying in place, the tips tend to wear out quickly, leaving sharp claws exposed

customer_reviews.title: Great caps but the glue will burn your cat.  Should be recalled
customer_reviews.text: These are a softer rubber than other brands which makes it much easier to squeeze open the tip and add glue. I'm deducting a star for the glue though...... DO NOT USE IT. It will burn and hurt your cat and maybe even you. The caps are great, but buy the Soft Claws cold bonding glue (available separately) instead of this awful stuff. I had no idea why the cats were freaking out until I got some on my fingertip. Holy $^#&*.....
customer_reviews.author: Just Lisa

customer_reviews.title: I wasn't so sure about these but my cat let ...
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't so sure about these but my cat let me put them on with no issues. They have stayed in place for 2 weeks now and they are saving my furniture and my skin !!! *** Remember..as the nail grows and your cat continues to try to sharpen it's claws the tips may poke through.
customer_reviews.author: Molly Cronin

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: I feel like this isn’t being rated appropriately. It seems that people are giving this a bad rating bc of their cat not wanting their paws touched and not the actual product. I honestly thought it was gonna be insanely hard to do but you just squeeze a little glue into the nail cap and it literally just slides onto their nail.. my kitty has had them on for a week now and they’re still holding up well! I can tell her nails are starting to grow but not a single one has come off. If your kitty will let you touch their paws then this is an awesome product. :) and super easy to put on!
customer_reviews.author: KayKay

customer_reviews.title: Seem to work!
customer_reviews.text: I was really nervous to put these on my cat at first because they are fitted with superglue. Although it took me a long time to actually put them on after receiving them (I'm always busy and thought it would take a long time to put them on), once I did I was fairly satisfied. The process of applying them was not difficult at all and only took about 20 minutes. My only complaints are that a couple of them fell off by the next day and they sometimes make annoying sounds when my cat is kneading satin sheets.
customer_reviews.author: Paige Graham

customer_reviews.title: Don't use the glue, but they're still good caps
customer_reviews.text: Use a different glue like the reviews said, these didn't stay on as long as the harder varieties but for the price you get so many more and are able to continually put back on your pet. A good thing is tho if you leave it on too long the claw grows a lot better with these rather than the harder variety. However DO NOT USE THE GLUE. I just sniffed it and it smelled awful and instead swapped out for some hospital grade superglue and that worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Inamasque

customer_reviews.title: Very thin, claws poke through!
customer_reviews.text: I have used similar products from many different companies. Immediately upon taking these out of the packaging I knew they were inferior. These caps are so flimsy that my cats claws poked right through! This completely defeats the purpose if you use them to keep the cats from scratching furniture or children! Also, the colors are not separated into individual bags like other companies, so you have to dump the whole thing out to pick a matching set. This is very poorly designed and poorly executed. I do not recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amber Canaan

customer_reviews.title: It works & adorable! Cat adjusted very well.
customer_reviews.text: These work beyond my expectations. My cat has had them on for four weeks now. She still scratches her scratch post but doesn’t do the damage to the furniture she was. I only wish there was an applicator so I didn’t get glue in my fingers. It it definitely a two person job. My cat adjusted pretty well and walked normally with just a couple paw shakes as she walked for first couple days. She looked adorable. She’s a small cat, about 4 1/2 lbs so I got the Small caps. They were perfect. I guess I will replace as they fall off. So much better than the cruelty of declawing.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Hammond

customer_reviews.title: These have been perfect! We recently adopted a cat
customer_reviews.text: These have been perfect! We recently adopted a cat, and we don't believe in declawing.Though we weren't sure how the cat would react to our two dogs, so we decided to use caps for the first month or so of being home for the animals to get acquainted so no one got hurt. They were extremely easy to put on, (Though we have an EXTREMELY chill loving cat, not all cats will react the same.) when putting them on just make sure you don't get any fur caught in with the glue and cap. I have absolutely no complaints.These worked perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Kendall Cavanagh

customer_reviews.title: THEY BLINDED MY CAT
customer_reviews.text: I’m beyond disgusted and infuriated with this product. We had the vet attach these to our cat, so we know it was done right. I came home a few days later and her eye was swollen. The next day it was swollen shut and she was attacking us. We rushed her to the vet where she peed all over herself and started attacking herself. The nail cap had cut her eye so deeply that she may be blind. They’re SO SHARP that they blinded my cat. The COMPLETE OPPOSITE of what they’re meant for. DO NOT BUY THESE.
customer_reviews.author: Charity Cody

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for scratchy kitties
customer_reviews.text: My cat 100% hates me, but these were extremely easy to use and put on. I feel like the small was a little large for my kitten but still fit with enough glue. The hardest part is getting the cat to cooperate. I was bit about 5 times and scratched more than I can tell you, but it has deterred my cats from scratching the couch. I only did the front paws. Not to mention they look pawfect on. The only thing I can say “negatively” is that with enough determination your cat may be able to chew one off, but that could also just be user error without enough glue.
customer_reviews.author: Cadlynne

customer_reviews.title: My butthead cat can't destroy my walls anymore!
customer_reviews.text: easy enough to use, depending on how well you apply really affects the longevity of the product--- so before he went spastic because he realized i was messing with him i was able to apply almost a whole paws worth of covers... no kidding they are still there and its been over a month- unfortunately he has now caught onto my scheme so proceeds to bite and claw me to the best of his ability when replacing any missing caps... he hates it.. but its oh so needed... i fear he's planning something big lol
customer_reviews.author: Jenniffer D

customer_reviews.title: ... clear "Soft Claw" brand of these and they work great. But these do not work great
customer_reviews.text: I have bought the clear "Soft Claw" brand of these and they work great. But these do not work great. The ends of them got worn down very quickly, leaving a good portion of the cat's nail exposed, but the sides have not fallen off yet and it's been months. There's no way that's good for the cat.
customer_reviews.author: El

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase! If you’re on the fence, just go for it.
customer_reviews.text: Placed these on my cat’s front paws to end getting constant snags in my clothing. He didn’t like it at first, but he quickly adjusted after the first 24 hours. They really are easy to apply, but be extra careful with that adhesive - it’s CA flue, so it will instantly glue your fingers together or glue your fingers to your cat, if you aren’t careful! It’s not difficult - just take caution to keep the glue in the nail cap only.
customer_reviews.author: Brian W.

customer_reviews.title: Low quality
customer_reviews.text: I've used the name brand version of these, although it's been a while. I have a rather rambunctious kitty I was hoping to dissuade from using his claws on everything in the house while we work on proper training. The tips of these wore through in just a few days. They're still attached with the glue, but his padding around the house has worn them down to the point where his claws are already exposed. Now instead of claw caps he has Madonna gloves. The authentic ones are much more durable.
customer_reviews.author: Head Mistress

customer_reviews.title: annoying cat great nails
customer_reviews.text: love animals but my cat is a territorial pest and when she finds that she dosent get her special sheba food she retaliates with no regret leaving me with scratched persian rugs leather purses shoes roommate screams constantly know i hate your cat now all is better she cant scratch my kids now it is a great thing to have for my prissy ticked tabby wish i would have found them sooner
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Good product for the price. I got a medium for my small framed cat. He is about 7 1/2-8 pounds full grown and at first I thought a medium was too large, but they have stayed on great for a week so far! *** make sure you allow the nails to have some growth to allow for the nails to adhere properly, and also make sure to allow a little space between the nails cap and the cats skin, it will help them adjust to the caps. My cat took 20 minutes or so to adjust, but he doesn’t even notice them now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: PLEASE DON'T BUY! This will HARM your pet!!!
customer_reviews.text: Please don't buy these to save a few dollars. Buy Soft Claws brand if you must have nail caps. These are cheap Chinese products. The glue BURNS your pet!!! Put it on your own skin first and see for yourself! I wasn't smart enough to test before putting it on my cat and it disintegrated her fur and burned my finger. I felt so guilty and sad and reading the very FEW comments about similar or worse things happening I didn't catch before buying, this is because the company will send you free products if you rate them 5 stars and give a good review. So a lot of these reviews are untrustworthy.
customer_reviews.author: NetCat

customer_reviews.title: Don’t last
customer_reviews.text: Caps are poor quality compared to other brands I’ve used in the past. The cap is still glued to my cats nail but the tip has broken off so if he sticks his nails out, he could scratch. Company says because of the material they’re made out of, this could happen if chewed on or scratched with but this never happened with the caps I bought at the pet store. Just saying.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Lessing

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Can barely get them on and then within days some are off and some are pierced through the end, making them pointless after a whole lot of trauma for the cat to put them on
customer_reviews.author: Katy

customer_reviews.title: Always cap, never declaw!
customer_reviews.text: I love these but I can't say the kittens do. The caps are very good quality and I saw no irritation issues from the glue. They've stayed on for a whole day so far but I can't say how long they will actually last because I know they will outgrow them. I will say I think they include more glue than necessary but at least it gives you extra if one dries up or maybe for more caps if you can buy those separately. Great for saving your furniture and infinitely better than inhumane declawing.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these when Soft Paws disnt have the color/size I normally get. I didnt use the glue due to others poor reviews on it and used the left over Soft Paws glue brand. But the caps themselves are also bad. It's just a sheath of thick rubber/plastic to glue onto their nails. He chewed through all of the tips within 30 minutes while the rest of the cap stayed in place so it was kind of useless since his sharp tips were still exposed and the base was colorful....
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Long

customer_reviews.title: Your cat's mood might change
customer_reviews.text: Although these are super cute, my cat hated them, some fell off, some were chewed off, some had to be reapplied within minutes. I probably won't use these again seeing as though my cat can't climb with them on. I watched a terrible attempt of my cat trying to climb up his 6 foot tower and of course he fell on the floor because he couldn't get a proper grip. His mood had changed with these "nails" on and he seems kind of needy. Although the ideal for the nail caps are fantastic, I won't watch my cat suffer so I will not be using these again.
customer_reviews.author: Rita M. Mobley

customer_reviews.title: Work great
customer_reviews.text: My cat was just fine with me putting them on. He’s a laid back cat but just to help him ease into the idea, I only applied 2 on each foot for starters, just to let him get used to the feel. He chewed on them a little bit I think it’s because I accidentally glued some foot hair as well. Otherwise these worked great, I did trim down the wide end and made them shorter when I read somewhere that cats walk on their toes. I wanted him to be as comfortable as possible. He did fine, they’ve stayed on for months and my furniture is rescued.
customer_reviews.author: Jill E. Cornwell

customer_reviews.title: Saved my furniture!!
customer_reviews.text: I had heard horror stories from friends about putting caps on but it went fantastic for me. My cat loves them. We took it slow and put one on at a time, she’d walk around the room then come back for the next one. It was super easy to put on her. I do recommend not clipping the nails first since the long nails helped them go on so nice. She hasn’t chewed them off or anything. I am soo soo happy with this product and would recommend to anyone that’s trying to find a way to save your furniture without declawing. Not every cat has the right temperament for them but at this price its definitely worth trying!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Went onto Amazon to order a larger amount of nails for a cheaper price compared to going to a store like Petco or petsmart... **PROS** 1. The amount of nails, and the colors for the price is awesome! 2. The nails are sturdy, and held up well for a couple weeks I don't have any cons, I used a different glue that had a stronger bond mostly for my own preference. Overall very happy with this purchase and would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: They really work!
customer_reviews.text: It's definitely a learning curve. First few times I made a mess and had more fur glued to my fingers than my cat on his paws! Once you get your system worked out it's a breeze. My cat doesn't even pay attention to them. I only put them on the back paws to keep her from scratching her fur out. She has allergies that cause her to pull out all her fur and create bloody sores. 100% improvement with these nails. Best thing ever!!
customer_reviews.author: Deerose

customer_reviews.title: Very thin
customer_reviews.text: I have always ordered a different brand but I was bored with the limited colors so I decided to give these a try. The minute I opened the box I felt the difference. They are thinner and they don’t feel sturdy at all. The other brand was way thicker. I am not even trying these on for I don’t want to risk another leather sofa. I am returning them. The package was nice, it was more for the money and the colors are nice this is why I gave them 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Great way to keep kitten from scratching you up
customer_reviews.text: I love these soft claws. My kitty isn't one yet so he is very playful. He especially loves to pounce on our legs as we leave or enter a room. These definitely make the pouncing bearable. A couple of the claws came of at first, but now that the rest are covered it was pretty easy to add more glue and stick it back on. Even though my cat is still a kitten he is very large. He weighs almost 12 pounds and the medium fit great. I would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: NatyB

customer_reviews.title: Good for some
customer_reviews.text: It’s probably just my hard headed cat but she absolutely hated these. We thought within an hour she would get used to them but it took three days for her to stop trying to rip them off and she succeeded getting 4 off. They are easy to apply but I think it depends on the cat really if you’re going to get it to work for you.
customer_reviews.author: Desiree Collum

customer_reviews.title: They run large
customer_reviews.text: I have FIV+ cats. They are not allowed outside and have a tendency to scratch where they shouldnt. I ordered the small and wish I got the extra small. All of my cats are over 9 pounds. This product is from China and the glue writing is all in Chinese. I didnt trust the glue because of different animal health standards. They send a lot of glue. I bought my own to make sure my animals were safe.
customer_reviews.author: nicky vale

customer_reviews.title: Glamorous claws
customer_reviews.text: I love these at first my cat had a hard time adjusting to them but now they are like second nature! They fit perfectly onto her claw once u apply the soft claw hold it onto their natural claw for a couple of seconds to make it secure but now me and my kids can enjoy our pet without getting scratched up I love these many colors many choices will order again!
customer_reviews.author: clelacece

customer_reviews.title: Humane and affordable!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my 8 week old kitten. Since she’s smaller than the sizes listed, I purchased XS and trimmed them to fit her nails. They were fairly easy to apply, considering. 😆 They’ve been on a few days and only two have fallen off and I’m certain it was user error. I received 10 colors, 10 of each. Pretty decent colors and some glitters.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: They didn’t stay on for crap. Not sure if it’s the glue or what
customer_reviews.text: I have bought other brands and decided to try these cheaper ones. They didn’t stay on for crap. Not sure if it’s the glue or what. Ones from pet smart lasted 3-4 weeks these were less the. 5 days
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer S.

customer_reviews.title: Great product, easy to use and cat doesn't mind them at all.
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing. Such a great and humane alternative to declawing. Saves our furniture and our feet at night. Easy to put on or your vet probably can put them on.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey Ware

customer_reviews.title: directions were well written and easy to follow
customer_reviews.text: directions were well written and easy to follow. kind of wish they had better pictures of how to put them on the nail, as in, how far they should go, and also, it does not say how long it takes for them to dry, which is good to know, or what to do, if the cat chews them off, falls off, etc. other than that they are decent....my cat has chewed off 2 of them, and they came apart easily...
customer_reviews.author: kittymagik

customer_reviews.title: Precious not feeling this
customer_reviews.text: My cat was destroying a new sofa so to the vet we go. The tech say it was easy to put the tip on my cat . She is fashionable with her new tip but is trying to take them off of her nails. I love my cat and the tips ( it a life saver for her and me too)
customer_reviews.author: LaWanda Beard

customer_reviews.title: 2 person Job!!
customer_reviews.text: They work great a little hard for one person to put on would advise one to hold kitty and one to deal with glue and nails! I did it myself and glued caps to my fingers several times when the kitty moved!! Love them though and have lasted over 2 weeks!
customer_reviews.author: Wlandrum60

customer_reviews.title: My furnitures loves them/My cat hates them
customer_reviews.text: These are a great alternative to declawing. However, these are a little softer than other brands and so my cat is able to chew off the tips. In general, they work well, but I find that the thicker caps work better.
customer_reviews.author: Kay P

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I keep buying these from different people, and these have that highest quantity and variety of color choices so far. They seem to be staying on. The color choices are adorable. More feminine then masculine which works since my cat is a female.
customer_reviews.author: Diva2001a

customer_reviews.title: Purrrrrfect
customer_reviews.text: My cat was destroying my furniture. Now he’s much better thanks to these adorable and easy to use claw caps!
customer_reviews.author: Savvy Gina

customer_reviews.title: So I just got the nails today and he’s already ...
customer_reviews.text: So I just got the nails today and he’s already trying to bite them off I need help ?! He’s mad and don’t want them on there how long does it take for them to adjust to them ?!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Reyes

customer_reviews.title: They really do work
customer_reviews.text: These I didn’t believe work but they do! A little bit of a challenge to put on kitten but once Ingot a full st on it wasn’t hard. I need a friend to help me hold kitten . I use gorilla glue the glue that comes with did not work maybe I was doing it wrong . I plan on buying another pack . Great product
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Cooper

customer_reviews.title: funcolors
customer_reviews.text: these are perfect to keep kitten from scratching everyone! Took her about 4-5 hours and she forgot they were ever on. Does take a little skill to get them on and they do have to be replace after about 2-3 weeks (they fall off or she has gotten them off) - but all in all a better idea than mutilating her with declawing
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: A lot of caps, colors all mixed together.
customer_reviews.text: Caps came in a hard plastic case. All colors are mixed together in one bag, so picking out just one was out of the question. She ended up with rainbow nails. Caps were put on by the groomer, so I can't speak to how good the glue bottle is, but most of the caps stayed on for a few weeks. A couple came off quickly, but only after my cat was biting at them for half the day. Good value, and I have a ton left for the next few appointments.
customer_reviews.author: Justin B

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put on
customer_reviews.text: A lot easier to put on than i thought. Maybe the formula of the glue changed but some dropped on my finger and it didnt burn and came off with soap and water. This made me feel better about applying it to the kitties as i was worried about how the glue would feel for them. Im curious to see how long they will last.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Castro

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy these,horrible quality!
customer_reviews.text: HORRIBLE quality! These are all supposed to be xs size but as you can see in the photo they are various sizes and many oddly shaped. The glue burns, the only acceptable place for these is the trash can, what a waste of money :(
customer_reviews.author: bekah0656

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: These are a life saver!! My cats hated getting them put on but they eventually got use to them. I only did the front paws and have enough colors. Just don’t forget to clip their nails first then put them on.
customer_reviews.author: Cassie

customer_reviews.title: Have fun
customer_reviews.text: Works great but you try holding them down! It's a 2 man job. Be careful to make sure they fall off when they are supposed to other wise they will curl with cat nail. After a while they realize it isn't worth it and stopped scratching
customer_reviews.author: kayla young

customer_reviews.title: Never fall off
customer_reviews.text: They say to change them every 3 weeks but our active outdoor cat has kept the original set on for 2 months and counting! And our carpet & baby are now safe from scratches.
customer_reviews.author: Serenity

customer_reviews.title: cute
customer_reviews.text: These caps are super easy to put and she didn't seem to mind the 10 minute process. I was hoping it would prevent her from wanting to climb my curtains...no luck. whomp, whomp, whomp
customer_reviews.author: amanda

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!! And Puuurrrrfect
customer_reviews.text: These work awesome I love them and I don’t think my cat notices them so they must not be uncomfortable. The only recommendation I would make for people is to make sure that you clip your cats nails as if you let them grow too long they poke through the caps.
customer_reviews.author: KWWeeden

customer_reviews.title: Unsafe
customer_reviews.text: There no ingredients on the glue. It says don’t put on your skin or mouth. Cats bite it to get it off if they’re not used to it. Obviously this isn’t safe for their nails.
customer_reviews.author: Brielle

customer_reviews.title: Love the cat paw covers
customer_reviews.text: These are great. Better then the more expensive ones. They fit larger and are easier to put on and they don't cry when you push them on. The expensive ones when I tried to put them on....my cats meowed so violently it sounded like I was causing them extreme pain. Now they don't cry.
customer_reviews.author: Kristie Stadtlander

customer_reviews.title: Not So Great
customer_reviews.text: I tried these on my cat, I followed the instructions by my vet. Well, my cat wasn't too pleased. Within a week, the nail caps were completely off! May want to try a Better Quality product*
customer_reviews.author: Aurea Northrop

customer_reviews.title: They work!!
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing! Once the kitty gets used to them and quits trying to pull them off. For the most part, it has only taken a few days. The instructions are straight forward and they are easy to use. Easier on a sleeping cat! My furniture may just be salvaged!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Meh...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one package of small and one medium. You could not distinguish between the two. The variety of colors is nice and each package came with six or more tubes of glue. Beyond the fact that they were all the same size, the tips also broke easily. If you have a lot of cats to cap then its worth it. For me it was annoying that they broke so quickly. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Glue gets hot
customer_reviews.text: I won’t be purchasing these again. The glue got really hot for some reason and it hurt my cats. At first I wasn’t sure why they were freaking out so much during the application, but after I put some on my finger I figured it out pretty quick.
customer_reviews.author: Marissa Hobbs

customer_reviews.title: Our cat DID NOT like this process
customer_reviews.text: Ya'll. Yes they do work, but be prepared to spill some blood. Our cat DID NOT like this process. I ordered the small size for our girl and probably should have gone down to the xs. She is 5/6 pounds. She has so far chewed off 4 and I've had to reapply. I do recommend them but suggest you have a team of people to help lol
customer_reviews.author: Donna Price

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, but not good
customer_reviews.text: Put my first set on my cat. He chewed off the tips of the covers within the first couple days, which I'm sure he wouldn't do now that he's used to them. However, they're taking forever to fall off so I cant replace them.... and now he is still clawing my furniture through the tips he's chewed off.... Not bad, but not good.
customer_reviews.author: JHole

customer_reviews.title: Works!!!
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly. Stayed glued for a few weeks. You need to trim the tip of your cats nails for best results. And preferably have someone helping you by holding the cat for you. I did it alone the first time and it didn’t go well. 😂 my cats didn’t like it. But after they got away they didn’t notice them on at all.
customer_reviews.author: nicole libby

customer_reviews.title: 8/10 would buy again
customer_reviews.text: They are a pretty soft silicone. They adhere really well and do not come off easily howeve, the tips get ripped off if the cat tries to scratch on his post. So far it’s not a big issue but I’m curious how they’ll work if the nails start growing thru the broken tip and I can’t get the old one off to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Horrible fit
customer_reviews.text: The caps did not fit as expected. I ordered xs, which is what was sent, but they were too large. They fell off after allowing the glue to dry. I’m not certain, but I think they are for puppies and not cats, even though they are marketed as cat covers.
customer_reviews.author: Bill J

customer_reviews.title: Does not work
customer_reviews.text: The sizes are way off. I cannot even use the size that was listed because it's way too big
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my kitty who likes to knead and climb on my new leather couches. I went in search for a solution and found this wonderful invention. I applied them by myself with absolutely no issues and Buster has kept them on for 2 weeks so far. They don’t seem like they’re coming off anytime soon. One paw is yellow and one paw is red, and Buster doesn’t even seem to notice them on his paws. Would recommend to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Meredith Gallaher

customer_reviews.title: Good Value for Tolerant Cats
customer_reviews.text: A little thinner material than softpaws cap. I think because if this my cat can chew the tips of these off easily. I was scared to order due to the burning glue comment so tested it myself first and no side effects. Overall good value if your cat tolerates these. I have two cats one does just fine with the caps and doesn’t try to pull them off at all. The other has already managed to chew the tip off of a cap in less than an hour.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan S.

customer_reviews.title: Not with the discount, pay the money for Soft Paws
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money on this "bargain". Go for the real soft paws brand because these are very thin and even though I trimmed the claws beforehand, my cat was still able to scratch at the carpet THROUGH the plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Steph Brandenburg

customer_reviews.title: My black demon kitty hated me but I  loved these
customer_reviews.text: My poor kitty had no idea what was in store for him once these dandy caps arrived- love the design and they have helped preserve my furniture.....for now. I can already see my kitty plotting his revenge.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa Christophersen

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: These work so great for our cat! She does tend to tear them off but I think it’s more due to the people who put them on tend to get some of her fur stuck in the glue. Otherwise they hold up for about a month before I need to give her a new set.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cat scratch!
customer_reviews.text: The product is good, and a good idea but the cats do not like to cooperate!! Wear armor while trying to do this. Lol
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Mohr

customer_reviews.title: Stay away from these terrible things.
customer_reviews.text: They smell so strong!! I open these and the plastic smell is too strong I won’t use these. I have had other brands and did not experience the same issue. They are made in China. Stay away from these terrible things.
customer_reviews.author: Marta

customer_reviews.title: Love them, and so does my furniture!
customer_reviews.text: These work great. The only down side is I have 2 male cats and I got a lot of pink covers. Luckily, the older cat is extremely comfortable with himself and feels ok wearing the pink covers. I'll order again.
customer_reviews.author: julie b

customer_reviews.title: Quality item
customer_reviews.text: Worked great and lasted more than 2 weeks per application. I just replaced them as they came off. My cat definitely didn’t like them at first, but then he didn’t mess with them at all.
customer_reviews.author: Moomof3

customer_reviews.title: Cat doesn't like it but they work. Get ready to chase your cat around if they are frisky
customer_reviews.text: These are great and very entertaining to look at. They do keep the cat from tearing furniture up. However I have a rowdy boy cat and he hates when I put them on he runs all over the house. He also tries to pluck them off. That's ok we'll just punish him with the pink toenails!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mommy Percolate

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely recommend
customer_reviews.text: I love these! You can get two sets at petsmart for 15 dollars. Ridiculously expensive. This is a way better option! They lasted us for several months and stayed on. Will be re-purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan Michal

customer_reviews.title: Cats are not impressed
customer_reviews.text: I am not sure if it is the cats or us but we can seem to get these things to stay on for more than 5 days. The cats go nuts once they are on and they try to chew them off.
customer_reviews.author: ryan sevart

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: You can’t beat the price for them. They last just as long as the ones at major pet supply stores.
customer_reviews.author: Carla Lawson

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: We LOVED the assortment of colors. This is such a fun and harmless way of keeping our cats from scratching up our furniture and rugs. Plus, they look FABULOUS!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Great for protecting furniture
customer_reviews.text: These work great for keeping our cat from scratching our new leather couch. They last a really long time, like at least a month per set and our cat didn't mind them at all.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Chapdelaine

customer_reviews.title: Not safe.
customer_reviews.text: I would not get these. I bought these in desperation when my cat was clawing everything in the house. I put several on exactly like the instructions said and was incredibly careful with the glue and placement. She ripped two off within an hour and the rest within a few days. When she got them off, her skin was super red and irritated. It’s not safe. Go to the vet and have it done.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Sommerville

customer_reviews.title: Pet Cat Kitty Soft Claws Cap
customer_reviews.text: I use this weekly. Even when using super glue they manage to get one off at a time as they grow out. I just reapply them. Very colorful
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: I believe this product is as good as any on the market. My young cats are relaxed when putting them on, of course I always touched their paws before I purchased so they are used to it. I would recommend these. I bought size xs for them they are 3 1/2 months old. Very useful product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great find great bargain
customer_reviews.text: Great product...get over a hundred more than pet store for same price and there just as good...
customer_reviews.author: martha johnson

customer_reviews.title: Hopefully will keep the cat from destroying furniture
customer_reviews.text: Have to pick through the bag to get the same colors and some colors there was not enough to do both front paws. They do stay on.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Didnt last more than a few days and literally made all my cats fingers bald.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime

customer_reviews.title: If you can get them on they're awesome!!!
customer_reviews.text: These help keep scratching at bay. The only downside is that my kitty won't sit still long enough to put them on. He was being neutered so I had the vet put them on while he was out. They realty help and he had no issues walking out getting used to them. They started coming off around week 2. It's now week 5 and some are still on!
customer_reviews.author: Sjbuddes

customer_reviews.title: Love the various colors
customer_reviews.text: Love the various colors. Don't love how thin the caps are because the cats nails poke through them within a day or two of placing them on him, even after trimming his nails. Super fast shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Ray

customer_reviews.title: Works well but apple cider vinegar is quicker and cheaper
customer_reviews.text: It does what it says it does but it took about a week to completely get the mole that wasn't large and then about a month to heal after whereas for cheaper i bought vaseline cotton balls apple cider vinegar and coconut oil and a similar sized was gone and completely healed in a week
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: I approve
customer_reviews.text: I’m happy with them. In a month on cat lost 2 out of 8 claws, one lost 3 out of 8, and the third lost 5 out of 8. The last lost the most because he was the first done and I most likely didn’t use enough glue.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Colors are great, and my cat does really well with wearing ...
customer_reviews.text: Colors are great, and my cat does really well with wearing them! Was very easy to apply, and she doesn't seem to mind them, unless she's trying to jump up to my bed! We've since gotten her a step thing, since my bed height is a bit too high for her to jump anymore without the use of her nails! Very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Alger

customer_reviews.title: Not really worth it
customer_reviews.text: It’s difficult to hold your cat still long enough to get these on. The glue or either her chewing on them made sores around her toes. She was able to chew the tips off.
customer_reviews.author: stephanie stickelman

customer_reviews.title: Not the proper size
customer_reviews.text: These were way to large for my cat. I used the sizing chart and they were still too large for her.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip & Samantha Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Works well!
customer_reviews.text: These are easy to apply (as long as your cat is cooperating) and they stay on for about three-four weeks (which probably depends on how active your cat is). They may need trimming beforehand depending on how long your cat's claws are, but otherwise they work like a charm. Just be careful with that glue, it is VERY strong!
customer_reviews.author: Vives

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Good product, cats aren’t crazy about it, can’t blame them, it works but luckily they aren’t scratching on the leather couch.
customer_reviews.author: Caya50

customer_reviews.title: Was a nice thought.
customer_reviews.text: What a joke. Very small to hold of course. Hard to put on with an uncooperative cat. Nail clips work easier and faster.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Sitch

customer_reviews.title: Cat bit off nail cap tip
customer_reviews.text: So my cat bit the ends of the nails off. They are still super glued on so I can’t replace can’t replace them but his nail sticks put just enough to snag everything and not quite enough for me to trim it...idk if this is a normal problem, but beware that could happen
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: They were okay
customer_reviews.text: My cats were able to pick them all off within like a week and getting them on the cats was a hassle. But they worked while they were on.
customer_reviews.author: Macy Hutchison

customer_reviews.title: Great product, have bought many times
customer_reviews.text: These are so easy to use, they definitely save my furniture, my 3 cats don't mind having them on.
customer_reviews.author: jen carter

customer_reviews.title: Super cute
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't say these are easy to apply because cats hate being held still but the product itself is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Erika Bruner

customer_reviews.title: Good variety and price
customer_reviews.text: Caps came right on time, kitten has had them on since purchase. She was biting them initally but it was her first time and with 5 other cats, expected. There is a good variety of caps and adhesive works well; price is better than local. No complaints at all. Will be purchasing again for othher cats as well.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome sauce
customer_reviews.text: I never had a problem when I buy these nail caps I use them for my job I run a mobile animal service and they're great
customer_reviews.author: LoveNmoniee💲

product_meta.title: JOYJULY 140pcs Pet Cat Kitty Soft Claws Caps Control Soft Paws of 4 Glitter Colors, 10 Colorful Cat Nails Caps Covers + 7 Adhesive Glue+7 Applicator with Instruction
product_meta.description:
Size:MediumSize Reference:
XS: Fit for kitten the age of 20 weeks,about 6lbs
S: Fit for the age of 6 months, about 6-11lbs
M: Fit for adult size cats, about 11-15lbs
L: Fit for large breed cats, about 15-20lbs

Apply on instruction (Better 2 people apply on)
Step 1.Test the size is proper or not: Try one cap on first without the glue. If it doesn't fit, trim the open and of each nail cap until they fit your cat claws snugly.
Step 2.Trimming cat nails and leave sufficient claw surface for the glue to adhere properly. (Kitten DO NOT need)
Step 3.Cut the glue pipe neck, and use the applicator to help you accurately drop glue into the nail cap. Filling 1/3 nail cap with glue, not too much or too little.(Please be careful and avoid dropping glue on your hands or your cat’s fur, if you do, remove it with use nail varnish remover or dispergator immediately. )
Step 4.Sliding the cap over the nail
Step 5.Waiting for 5 minutes before letting your cat go

Warm Tips:
* For the first time wearing the claw nails, some cats will try to bite them off, please try to distract them, until they get used to their new claws. Please do not worry, this is a normal behavior.
*Healthy Cat nail shell will come off Every 4-8 weeks in normal situation. So you need prune the nails and replace nail sets every eight weeks. In addition, the cats' nails have scalability, it is recommended that you leaving a little gap out when stick the nails, so that cats nails have Activity space.
*If you need to remove the caps off, please use nail varnish remover or dispergator.
feature_bullets: 【Safety Material】JOYJULY cat soft nail caps are made from natural vinyl resin, as Europe UNITASGS environmental certification, non-toxic, safe, durable. The glues have passed EU MSDS, safe and specially used for pet nail caps. The applicator can be used repeatedly and cleaned with water after use. If size problem or you have anything questions to our cat nail caps, we support replacement or 100% refund. Please feel free to contact us.

【Size & Package】Only for cats, XS older than 5 months. Package including 140pcs cat nail covers+7pcs glues+7pcs Applicator with instruction. There are total 14 colors in the package. Including 4 glitter colors (gold, pink, blue and purple), 10 different colors random of these colors(black, clear, red, green, blue, pink, gold yellow, lemon yellow, orange, white, purple and orange). All colors you wanna are here to make your kitty more cute. Great amount for good value.

【Easy-to-Apply】 1. Trim cat nails(Kitten claws DO NOT need to be trimmed). 2. Fill a little glue into caps(Note: not too much). 3. Wait a moment when the glue is half dry, put it on your cat. 4. Until the glue is complete dry then begin the next. Applying on soft claw caps will not affect the normal expansion and contraction of the cat, majority of cats can adapt quickly. Some cats maybe not happy with their new claws for a couple days, try to chew the nail tips. Please be patient to wait your c

【Furniture, Skin Protector】Protect homes against destructive scratching by applying soft claws nail caps to cat nails, very easy to master at home to help the cat to complete the installation. When applied to front paws, they reduce the potential for damage due to your cat scratching behavior. Nail Caps for cats can also be applied to hind paws to help reduce aggravation of existing skin conditions due toe excessive scratching.

【Warm Tips】1. If the size you order is slightly larger for your cat, just cut a part on the opening end. 2. USUALLY, these soft nail claws last 4-8 weeks. Different cats exercise, exercise environment (such as concrete, lawn, or home floor, carpet) and so on, the wear rate for nail sets are not the same, some wear a couple days may wear out. Some can wear 1-2 months or even longer. 3. Any problems, we offer 100% replacement or refund within 30 days. Thanks!
